text: Is the US job market beginning to weaken?  Friday's employment report may provide hints  —  America's employers added a vigorous 272,000 jobs in May, accelerating from April and a sign that companies are still confident enough in the economy to keep hiring despite persistently high interest rates.

Statement from President Joe Biden on the May Jobs Report  —  The great American comeback continues, but we still have to make more progress.  On my watch, 15.6 million more Americans have the dignity and respect that comes with a job.  Unemployment has been at or below 4% for 30 months—the longest stretch in 50 years.
